Class StandardSampler

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.AbstractSampler
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.StandardSampler
public class StandardSampler extends AbstractSampler
An implementation of the Abstract sampler based (mostly) on the Normal distribution.
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Enterprise Systems Group @ York University

  • Constructor Details

    • StandardSampler

      public StandardSampler()

    • StandardSampler

      public StandardSampler(float txArrivalIntervalRate, float txSizeMean, float txSizeSD, float txValueMean, float txValueSD, float nodeHashPowerMean, float nodeHashPowerSD, float nodeElectricPowerMean, float nodeElectricPowerSD, float nodeElectricCostMean, float nodeElectricCostSD, float netThroughputMean, float netThroughputSD, double difficulty)
      Constructs a new Sampler object with the given parameters. Parameters define means and standard deviations of the corresponding distribution (mostly Normal).
      Parameters:
      txArrivalIntervalRate - The arrival interval rate of transactions (tx/sec).
      txSizeMean - The mean transaction size (bytes).
      txSizeSD - The standard deviation of transaction size (bytes).
      txValueMean - The mean transaction value (local tokens).
      txValueSD - The standard deviation of transaction value (local tokens).
      nodeHashPowerMean - The mean hash power of a node (hashes/second).
      nodeHashPowerSD - The standard deviation of node hash power (hashes/second).
      nodeElectricPowerMean - The mean electric power consumption of a node (Watts).
      nodeElectricPowerSD - The standard deviation of node electric power consumption (Watts).
      nodeElectricCostMean - The mean electric cost of a node (real currency per kWh).
      nodeElectricCostSD - The standard deviation of node electric cost (real currency per kWh).
      netThroughputMean - The mean network throughput (bps).
      netThroughputSD - The standard deviation of network throughput (bps).
      difficulty - The current difficulty level ([Search Space] / [Success Space].

    • getPoissonInterval

      public double getPoissonInterval(float lambda)
      Calculates a random interval following the Poisson distribution.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The parameter of the Poisson distribution (lambda greater or equal to 0). To be used for arrival rates.
      Returns:
      The random interval following the Poisson distribution.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if the provided lambda value is less than 0.

      public long getNextMiningInterval(double hashPower)
      See parent. Uses method getNextMiningIntervalMiliSeconds(double, double). Result in miliseconds.
      Specified by:
      getNextMiningInterval in class AbstractSampler
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getNextMiningIntervalTrials

      public double getNextMiningIntervalTrials(double difficulty)
      TODO: Test this! Get a random sample of the number of trials needed to successfully validate. Sampling formula is: Math.log(1-Math.random())/Math.log1p(- 1.0/difficulty))
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The difficulty under which the number of trials is generated.
      Returns:
      A number of trials needed for validation.

    • getNextMiningIntervalMiliSeconds

      public double getNextMiningIntervalMiliSeconds(double hashPower, double difficulty)
      Get a random sample of the number of seconds needed to successfull validate given specific hash power and difficulty. Works by first calling getNextMiningInterval(double) to get the needed trials and then dividing by the node speed (hashpower Giga-trials/second)
      Parameters:
      hashPower - The node's hashpower in Giga trials per second (billion trials per second)
      difficulty - The difficulty under which validation is taking place [Search Space]/[Success Space]
      Returns:
      A mining interval sample in milliseconds (msec).
